content:
published  January  

No one is arguing Facebooks right to set their own rules PERIOD What is being debated is the belief that the rules are wrong in themselves and should be changed PERIOD This is indeed a question of what is obscene or inappropriate and is precisely and exactly a question of whether breastfeeding images are obscene PERIOD Facebook set rules to prevent members from being subjected to obscene photos PERIOD Yes they had to draw a line somewhere PERIOD What is wrong with their standard is that it does not see any difference between bare breasts offered for titillation and breasts being used for their proper natural purpose PERIOD Its very simple The rules should be changed to allow for bare breasts if a baby is using them For the record there are still photos of topless women and nudity on Facebook probably because they have yet garnered no complaints PERIOD But let a breast be shown in actual use and some people just cant handle it PERIOD Get over it George Clarke Philadelphia resident
